stories.text:
Hi folks,

I've been looking into several options for how to build out a micro frontend architecture in Angular. There seems to be quite a lot of interest in this right now, between Angular elements, Webpack 5 with Module Federation, single-spa etc.

Im just curious if anyone has actually implemented it, what you learned from building out, what approach you took and would you do it the same way again?

Also any great articles out there for it?

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Angular Microfront End

stories.text:
I've noticed that it's much easier to make stealthy bots while using virtual android phones. I've made bots for tons of apps without getting blocked(when I was getting blocked on the PC website).

Would anybody be interested by a platform (kinda like Phantombuster) but for mobile?

You could automate any task on one or multiple virtual android phones.

You could easily click on the right buttons using OCR(character recognition) and extract data.

On almost any apps.

It would cost maybe 50 cents an hour by phone.
stories.title: Ask HN: Would anybody be interested by a Mobile automation platform?
